description:
Great chipotle food nothing special tho 

Order what u want and go down the line 

Would recommend if u need some quick food 

One of the better food spot here at the mall
author: Chiu H.

description: I don't put any salsa on my bowl and it was super spicy. And the beans tasted gross. By far worst tasting chipotle I've ever had.
author: Omar M.

description: What happened to my portion? Why I only got half of what I paid?!!! Where is my corn salsa?
author: Gung S.

description:
Thanks cashier girl who is also the manager of this chipotle. Thank you for charging me full price on your bogo promotion.

Chipotle have this promotion today for bogo if you wear the warriors gear but she charged me FULL PRICE. Her reason is that I didn't say that I want to do the warriors bogo promotion. So thank you for this awesome experience of knowing that you are blind and stupid.
author: Samantha K.

description:
Let me start by saying I'm a Chipotle fan. I've been going there since they opened, and while there may have been better burritos to be had in San Francisco's Mission District (from where Chipotle seems to have stolen their original food concept), I always liked their build-to-order preparation, prices, and fresh high-quality ingredients. So why the two stars? It's the tortilla, silly, the fundamental building block of any burrito.  Look, I'm no chef, but all I know is the tortillas have gone severely downhill from when this Chipotle first opened. At my last couple of visits, instead of a warm, flour-y tortilla that I could easily bite into, my burritos came wrapped in what I can only describe as a thick, rubbery, cold, and tasteless cover (I ate on the premises).  Why would you do this?
  
Seriously, I couldn't even chew through some of it, and when I bit into it, the texture was more similar to a pencil eraser than an actual tortilla.  Listen Chipotle management, please take my advice and plan a quick trip to literally any established burrito joint in the Mission, or even head over to Taqueria Los Mayas on Clement Street (one of my new favorites), and go order a burrito. Any burrito. Unwrap it, take a bite, and pay attention to the texture and flavor of the tortilla. Then go back to Chipotle and do the same thing. See the difference? FIX THIS before you go out of business! I'm on your side, and this problem is SERIOUS.

BTW, I've never had a problem with the staff or the service - people were always friendly and cooperative when I was there.
author: Richard A.

description: This is the worst chipotle I've ever been to. First, I paid for a drink and there was only like 2 drinks available the rest of them were "out of service". Second, I asked for guac and they literally just gave me half an avocado! It wasn't even guac!! And it still had the avocado skin on it. I told them about it and then asked for a new one, you would think they would throw it out and make a new one but no they didn't so the second guac they gave me still had the avocado skin on it... and then 3rd there was a hair in my bowl! At this point I was just fed up. Also the woman who rang me up had a HUGE hickey on her neck, so unprofessional.
author: Frederique R.

description: So I just tried the other Chipotle on Sloat and the experience is WAY better. The burrito bowl actually tasted great and the employees were friendly. The portion was decent and what it should be unlike this Stonestown location. It was such a world of difference. For anyone reading this, either take a bus or drive to the Lakeshore location instead, the food quality and portions are much better.
author: Ced C.

description: Chipotle by the mall, which is a good location. Kid friendly with a good amount of places to sit. Food is just like the other chipotles. Nothing really special  and they give you get a good amount. The girl at the cashier look like they did not want to be there. She looked annoyed and it's clearly displayed on her face. She could've smiled at least once.
author: Michelle C.

description: Never had such small portion at Chipotle, and the server was having bad attitude as well. Totally not worth it. Will not come back at all.
author: Esther L.

description: This place can get SO busy depending on the time you go. Food tastes fresh, usual taste! Customer service is 3/5. Portions are so small, they give you like no food especially if you order a burrito bowl. I would suggest asking for example "extra rice" and "extra beans" and "extra meat" because they usually will skimp out on those items. About $10 total for a bowl. $1.70 for chips.
author: Michele G.

description: My god this chipotle was one of the worse ive seen, because this place was unprepared, messy, rice, cream, and beans everywhere. The service was terrible, and they cant handle pressure. Also this is Stonestown for gods sake this cant be except able.
author: Anthony B.

description: If you pretty great quality food at a fair price, this is the place for you. In line and to my seat in 4 minutes. Love the new Queso sauce. Only thing I'd change is the price of guacamole when avocado is in season it seems high
author: Mark M.

description:
Not sure how to rate a place like Chipotle. In terms of food the chicken and steak was very juicy and flavorful, I happened to get a chicken quesadilla and it was the perfect amount of shredded cheese and chicken. However for around 6 bucks it's a bit too much. I can make one at home that is cheaper and 10x tastier.

The service was quick and easy and the workers there get a 10/10 hands down. Overall restaurant atmosphere is laid back and clean which is always a plus.

I'm not much of a chipotle fan in terms of the food but I can say you can get better Mexican food elsewhere.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I was craving a burrito and remembered that the few times I've tried Chipotle in the past, I didn't really care for Chipotle but years later decided to give them another try. 

I went in at around 7:30 - *8PM and walked up to the counter and read the menu. I didn't see much on the menu other than "Burrito 8.75 and something like "Burrito bowl" Can't remember the price and maybe tacos, I wasn't really paying that much attention but the variety of items seemed very limited. 

I asked the first girl to identify which meat is which and asked which is the carnitas, she pointed out the carnitas in the middle which oddly to me was shredded meat while the chicken and steak were cubed pieces. I guess there's different ways to prepare it but I'm used to carnitas (in Mexico) being cubed pieces and chicken and beef usually being shredded, 

Anyway, I say I want a carnitas burrito with pinto beans, brown rice and sour cream. She sends me down the line where another girl was preparing the rest of the burrito after the beans and rice and she asks "salsa? medium, hot or mild" to which I answer "medium but I just want 'very little' salsa" she takes this big spoon and scoops a whole big ladle of salsa on it really fast as if she didn't understand what I just said, then just looks at me and asks "anything else" and I say "sour cream" I'm a big fan of sour cream but again I didn't want as much as she put on my burrito! she takes another BIG scoop of sour cream and plops in on the burrito, she seemed very rude, and with a demeanor that said she doesn't want to be there and was pissed off about it. I didn't even see any cheese or remember to ask about it. 

Then I get to the register and the guy says "1 burrito, 9.50" and I'm thinking "wow that's a lot" I was expecting maybe 7.50 considering I didn't even order a drink and I can tell the burrito was very small. I sat down opened it up and realized just how small it is but I'm starving and had a hankering for a burrito; any burrito! I bit into it and the first thing I noticed is that the meat of all things was ice cold! no exaggeration. the beans and rice were warm, the salsa and cream were room temperature but who could tell about that, but the meat in the middle and there was very little of it, was really cold. Sorry but there is absolutely no excuse for that and especially if you have the nerve to charge 9.50 for one of the smallest burritos with the least meat in it that I have ever seen. The flavor was bland as well. 

The only other times I ever had Chipotle burritos before is when we were taking my niece to Gymboree on Sloat which was next to Chipotle and that was when she was 2 to 3 years old which was 3 to 4 years ago and I remember a burrito there was around 6.75 or around 7.50 with tax and I thought that was a ripoff! These tiny, tasteless burritos aint worth no 9.50! 

My final conclusion is that Chipotle sucks and is just a gimmick and I will never even consider eating there ever again.
author: David A.

description:
The portions are slowly decreasing and items are unevenly distributed throughout my steak bowl tonight. I had a decent scoop of salsa and corn but only like 10 strands of lettuce! The staff knew I would request more lettuce since I asked for more rice in the beginning so they quickly sealed my bowl and slide it towards the cashier. 

I'm from Fremont and the staff there are not as stingy. 

I never understand why the Chipotle staff at San Francisco are like this. I've been to the San Francisco Centre location and the one near Union Square. The rice portions are so small it's ridiculous.
author: Danae L.

description: I RARELY eat at chipotle. But today it was crowded everywhere and i was on my lunch break and couldn't have what I was craving cause it was a time sensitive situation and the lines were crazy. I settled for chipotle. Ordered 2 hard chicken tacos and she only put like 5 pieces of chicken in them. It was basically a veggie taco. Talk about stingy. I'm still hungry. I had the nerve to wonder why everyone else besides them was packed.
author: Mariah J.

description: I am a student at state right across the street so this location is the only that gives me less ingredients compared to other places. I try to avoid this place and only go if I have to. It is a hit and miss with how the things are prepped too. Its either the fajitas are too burned or the server spilled my rice all over the counter. There are other options like Blaze Pizza and the food court at the Stonestown Mall, I would recommend.
author: Amica J.

description:
It was okay. Not the best. My first time eating at any Chipotle. The Menu was small. Just Burrito, taco, and something called a big bowl. I just ordered a burrito, but you get to choose the rice, the beans, and the meat. then whatever condiments you want in it like sour cream, cheese, and how hot you want your hot sauce. They did ask me if I wanted corn, I said sure. I was surprised they put that into the burrito. 

The size of the burrito was smaller than the other burrito places I've eaten at. Actually, about 25% smaller. Compared to another restaurant in San Francisco like Gordos and Poncho Villa. 

To me, a burrito is a burrito. Should kind of taste the same as all other places. But at the first few bites, I've noticed that the burrito was somewhat cold. Perhaps it's the corn that made it cold. I like eating my burrito warm or hot. But this was partial Luke warm and a bunch of cold. It was weird. That's why the three stars. My first thought was do they have some sort of a microwave in the restaurant where a customer and zap it warmer. Nope. 

I was hungry. So the food tasted okay. But the cold burrito dropped it down the quality.
author: Jack L.

description: Chipotle is nice to eat once in awhile so my boyfriend and I decided to get some on Wednesday. We ordered online and we went to pick it up within 10 minutes. I was hoping they would give you a bigger portion but they don't. My boyfriend ordered the chicken tacos and I ordered the chicken burrito bowl. They were both a-ok. I'll only come here once a year and this place doesn't really satisfy me too much.
author: Monica W.

description: So I was eating at Chipotle yesterday until I saw a little mouse run from the back kitchen to the cashier and from the cashier to the dining area. Let's just say I left immediately... disgusting!!!!!
author: Diana A.

description:
Chipotle is now my favorite go to restaurant for burrito bowls and tacos. I came in right after my workout at the gym. There was no line when I entered which is a good thing. I ordered a chicken taco with chicken, cheese and lettuce on soft tortillas. The tacos are delicious and I enjoyed it. Also, I like that their food is freshly prepared and this is also something that keeps me coming for lunch. Overall, good first experience here!

Breakdown for rating:
- Freshness and deliciousness of the food (+1)
- Friendly staff members (+1)
- Service efficiency (+1)
- Clean facility (+0.5)
- Seating available inside and outside (+0.5)
author: Bennett W.

description: Typical Chipotle spot just like any other spot. Same shit different location. Walk in and there is a line. When its your turn you pick and choose what you like. At times the guys behind the counter cannot wrap a damn burrito. Once the cook cannot cook for crap as it was too salty then the rice was hard still? like really?! you can a negative star if i had a chance to rate that.  Thanks
author: Meishi M.

description: So I've been to this location twice now and both times the food was lackluster and the dining area was filthy. The rice has no taste to it whatsoever, there isn't enough meat in the burrito and certainly not worth the price chipotle charges. I've been to multiple chipotles and have never had a problem before. Disappointing as it is right next to campus.
author: Adam W.

description:
Terrible service. I asked for a quesorito, which is a tortilla, cheese, and another tortilla as the wrap. Just melting cheese for $3.50 extra is a compete ripoff. When i explained how to make it to the employees, they insisted i was wrong. The customer is never wrong. Read that again,  THE CUSTOMER IS NEVER WRONG. 

Let me break down how simple it is to make this. It takes maybe 30 extra seconds, plus no one was in line sono one had to wait that extra 30 seconds. You take foil, you put first tortillaon foil, you spread out cheese, you add second tortilla, you put another piece of foul on that, and then you heat it up. From that point on, it's like any other burrito. But the employees here had to make something that takes 30 seconds into a 5 minute ordeal, like I'm an idiot. 

I'm paying the company you work for my money, I will tell you how to make my burrito and you will make it, especially when your charging me $3.50 for 30 seconds of trivial labor.
author: Jon P.

description: Worst Chipotle ever. Bad customer service. Bad portions. Rude snobby employees who care more about their friends in line than the person up next. Drive over to the one off Sloat well worth it.
author: David D.

description: Rude ass customer service, rude as food service, rude ass cashier, rude ass bathrooms, rude ass portions, rude ass uneven distribution on topping inside my burrito, rude ass not grilled fajitas.
author: Laila D.

description: This place is run by the unmotivated, lacking students of SF state. They don't open on time, are extremely rude, and never make my burrito to satisfaction. Try hiring some better workers who know how to open on time.
author: Natalie D.

description: This chipotle is not better or worse than all others. I got chicken salad bowl for $7.56 and was very happy with it. The stuff was attentive and served a decent amount of each taping. Parking is available and there is an outdoor seating
author: Ilmia N.

description: Of all the Chipotle restaurants that I've been to, this one is at the bottom of list. It almost appears that every time I go there the person making my food is in training so there's never any consistency.
author: Peter L.

description: This Chipotle is by the far the worst! The burritos get smaller and smaller.. They're rude and didn't care when I told the cashier my complaint. She only swiped my card and walked away. This is the last time I waste my time and money.
author: Tammy H.

description: Great location but food preparation is terrible. I felt so wired as I am having my rice bowl because it didn't taste the same, and found out their spicy salsa tastes horrible. Plus the brown rice is half cooked:(
author: Hanna J.

description: When is yelp gonna give us the option to give 0 stars?????? This location is so damn stingy on their portions. I was getting my usual chicken burrito bowl and the girl looked miserable as hell so that was already a red flag. But what made things even worse is that when she was giving me chicken, she literally gave me a tiny ass spoonful. When I asked for more chicken, she immediately snapped and told me she was gonna charge me extra if I wanted more. Uh excuse me??????? You gave me hella little so girl bye! Anyhow my meal overall tasted bad, it lacked so much flavor. I'll stick to other locations. AVOID
author: Cee H.

description: The food here is very good and I enjoyed the taco plate. I'm a vegetarian and they accompany that very well. I also thought that the salsa was very good and went well with my taco plate.
author: David G.

description: This is a good location. They have outdoor seating and they move quick. They don't sweat you or give you super small portions like most of the locations in this chain. I like that their always well staffed and get you in and out fast
author: Alonzo T.

description:
Not a huge fan.

I appreciate the speediness of your order fulfillment w/ their assembly line. The meats are mostly borderline salty and not as tasty nor fresh as Cantina Verde in the FiDi. I've tried their tofu and it's just a mushy, salty mass.  

Price wise, very affordable for a quick meal. You can usually get in and out with 5 minutes if there isn't a line.
author: Julie L.

description:
Forgetting my wife had told me that chipotle had an E. coli scare and not to go there, I went there.
I was surprised to see no line as almost every time I've ever been to chipotle there is a huge one but in hindsight it all makes sense. Anyway I considered myself lucky, so I order my burrito bowl with extra chicken as I had just gotten out of the gym. Food tasted good, I was happy.
Until I got to work and had massive diarrhea. Although it was nice to lose a few pounds so quickly I knew it was just water weight. 
I want to go back but I don't want diarrhea. Maybe when I'm a few pounds away from my goal weight.
author: Everette R.

description:
Ill start off by saying the staff in general is great. They are always friendly and have a smile on their face. 
The food however is very inconsistent.  The meat some days is great and other days looks like its been sitting out all day. The portions are also extremely in consistent.  There are days where they skimp on all of the toppings and you have to ask for more consistently and others that have it down. Also when there is a line expect half the normal portion size.
author: Josh F.

description:
Damn, I'm not sure what all this hate is about. I've always had a normal experience at this particular Chipotle location. On that note, normal = 3 stars because nothing stood out either way.

+ SERVICE: College student run, college student frequented. That being said, the service has always been pretty nice. No one's ever been rude but I also can't blame anyone for not really caring too much about their job at a fast food restaurant (if this can be considered fast food). 

+ FOOD: Again, pretty typical of most Chipotles. My usual order is Carne Asada or Chicken Burrito with extra black beans, extra brown rice, extra lettuce, cheese, sour cream, tomato salsa and hot salsa for around ~$7.00.

+ SERVES BEER: I do enjoy beer. 

+ LOCATION: Connected to Stonestown Galleria and right off of the M Line. Boo yeahhhh. 

Bottom line, this Chipotle is just like any other Chipotle with the exception of the influx of college students. I ain't mad at it.
author: Chris W.

description:
Probably the worst Chipotle branch I've been to in terms of the food you get. 

All burritos in the past have been poorly wrapped. This time, my burrito was poorly wrapped, there was not enough foil to wrap around my burrito, the little bit of foil that WAS there was basically slapped on, and the server neglected to take the water out of the spoonfuls of the food she was scooping in (salsa water, veggie water, etc). Within a few minutes, the bag started ripping all over the place and I had barely made it into the door home which was ONLY a few blocks. 

Not really interested in going to this branch again.
author: Sofia R.

description: The workers here are always friendly. To those who complain about small portions, besides the meats, I would suggest to ask politely for extra. This is my fave location bc they always seem to get the chicken perfectly cooked.
author: AJ C.

description:
Always fresh and delicious.  But skimpy with the carnitas.  They served generous amounts of steak and chicken to the members of my party, but the serving of shredded pork left much to be desired.  

After noticing the disparity, I asked for a little more meat.  I was offered the double meat option or just "a little more".  All I wanted was "a little more", comparable to the portion of steak and chicken served to other members of my party.  All I got was a display of technical skill required to separate a splinter of meat from the whole!  SMH.

Regardless,  I'll still eat at Chipotle.  It's just too good to stay away from!  Maybe I should order the steak or chicken next time.  LOL!
author: Marcellus C.

description: This is my first time I'd been to this location. It wasn't my first choice to have lunch, but the place I wanted to go wasn't open at the heart of the lunch hour, for some strange reason. I entered and tried Chorizo burrito and it was ok, nothing to hoot about.
author: Larry F.

description:
This is by far the worst Chipotle I've been to in terms of portions. They even skimp out on rice; they don't even give you one full scoop and rice (I've never gotten more than half a scoop) is probably the cheapest thing to use as a filler! It's ridiculous that I have to ask for more rice. I've never seen such skinny burritos/burrito bowls from Chipotle before. I'm not trying to get more than what I should get, I just think I should get a regular serving. 

I'd give them one star, but I do love Chipotle--it's just this particular location sucks.
author: Doris K.

description:
Chipotle is chipotle.   Whoever is managing this place is not doing it up to par.  The burrito rollers, although nice, were too few and not trained well enough. Huge rice portions, small meat portions.  There were several employees in the back having a really good time while we waited longer than usual.

Food tastes just fine, but slow and unattentive.
author: David D.

description:
Favorite! Favorite! Most favorite place! I love their grilled chicken and corn salsa here. Carnitas is a bit sweet for me but other than that you can't go wrong. 

They offer a simple menu tacos, burritos, burrito bowl (burrito w/out tortilla in a bowl) and salads. 

Vegetarians can also find something to eat here-- having veggies and tofu options. 

Great place to grab a quick bite, family friendly and trendy spot for the younger crews. 

Must check it out!! I have it at least once a week LOL #guilty
author: Colleen K.

description:
It's definitely nice to have this Chipotle near SF State.  This is my go-to place for lunch after a big exam.  Anyway, this Chipotle, along with a Peet's Coffee shop, is located where the Chevy's used to be at Stonestown before it closed.

Some facts:

* It's definitely small compared to other Chipotles I've been to before.  The seats and tables are all placed close together and, if it's super busy, the line can and probably will go out the door.
* Some of the workers here are not the friendliest people I've met.  (Although this isn't too big of a problem.)

But, so far, transactions have been speedy and my burritos have always been delicious.  As long as this Chipotle is located where it is, I'll be back.  

4 stars
author: Michael F.

description: My very last time I had a Chipotle Burrito was back in May of 2013 when I was at Washington DC on a East Coast vacation tour... And now its a first to eat a steak burrito at Chipotle Stonestown area... I have to say now its twice now that... I have eaten a steak burrito at two different Chipotle locations!!! The steak burrito hasn't changed... The only thing that I didn't like was that you have to buy the chips in which it doesn't come free with the burrito... Oh well who cares that's Chipotle policy!!! Overall the steak burrito that I ate was ok!!! But If I had a choice of eating a burrito I rather prefer going to the Mission area!!!
author: William B.

description: Serves you the bare minimum of meat while the steak being as dry as beef jerky. Let along extremely over priced for some ghetto Mexican food
author: Alex S.

description:
This location always seems to be messy and kinda grimy. Oftentimes, the staff seem to be under-trained and confused. However, it is one of the only Chipotle locations around the area. 

Food quality was still good- I mean, Chipotle is Chipotle. I did feel like the portions were a bit "smaller" than other locations... but I just requested for a little bit extra :)
author: Samantha C.

description: So me and my friend ordered rice bowls. Now i have been to many Chipotle Mexican grills and i know the quantity they give in a rice bowl. But that day some guy left us astonished. The quantity he gave us was so so less that the other lady who was adding the sauces was going to say we charge extra for guac but she dint because she realized the guy had already put less rice n beans in the bowl! Really unprofessional service
author: Saurabh M.

description:
I love Chipotle chicken burrito bowls. I fondly remember living off 2 for 1 burrito bowls in college and I never left a Chipotle feeling unhappy until the new Stonestown Chipotle. I will stick with the Chipotle at Lakeshore Plaza. 

Complaints:
1. portions size of my burrito bowl is smaller than any other Chipotle I have been too
2. gave me the last 5 pieces of chicken and called it a full portion
3. told me that there would not be any chicken for another hour but after I pay a new batch comes out
4. ran out of guacamole two hours before closing and told me no more would be made
5. came out with fresh guacamole as I finished my last bite of my burrito bowl
6. staff not friendly and misinformed

I did come only a week after opening, so I would be willing to give this Chipotle another chance.
author: Andrew W.

description:
$15 for burrito and a soda. Can you believe it?! What a RIP OFF!!!  I thought for the price this was gonna be something special. Nope. Tasteless $5 steak burrito for$12! No juice, no flavor, massively over cooked tasteless steak and no hot peppers in a Mexican restaurant! $2.25 extra for a $1.00 addition of guacamole. Next time I'll save half the price, leave the mall and eat at a local spot!

Go ELSEWHERE, anywhere!
author: Scott S.

description:
I dont know how the hell they wrap burritos at home but some of the workers here wrap the burritos into jumbo sized hand grenades. I swear you wont be able to go into the airport with one without getting arrested for being a possible terrorist.

Also dont come here within 2 hours of closing cause the tortillas still come out cold, or maybe i was just unlucky and the Caucasian guy working the line rushed it off the press.

The female workers here for the most apart are on point when it comes to dealing with the line of hungry people.

Aisde from the cold tortilla, the counter strike bomb looking burrito.
The other only concern would be the steak being left out to dry in front of the window screen during the ordering processes.
author: Eric C.

description: was there 7/6 evening visit. ordered 3 bowls to go. didn't want rice or beans in one & asked for bowl with lettuce on bottom, if you read most of the reviews, most say a few strands of lettuce or nothing more than a thin layer covering the bottom if that! every thing the scoop is chincy at best & they try to go thru the options as fast as possible & like a couple of reviews state push you thru & cover it up. the guy said if I didn't top of with lettuce, let me give you a side of lettuce, the container they use can not hold more than a tablespoon, TABLESPOON! yhis guy was in such a hurry, that he greeted you on taking order to pushing it to the Cashier! Where they shorthanded & he felt he had to assemble the entire order by himself? $8.for 1/2 a bowl of lettuce & a protein! Think before eating Chipotle foods. TOTAL RIP OFF & RUDEST SERVICE IN THE INDUSTRY!
author: david c.

description:
We went to Chipotle for the first time for dinner and it was okay.
I had a carnitas quesadilla which was pretty good with lots of cheese.  I was disappointed that they did not have any genuine Mexican hot sauces, just Tabasco sauce which isn't good with Mexican food.
My partner had a carne asada burrito and was happy with that.
Chipotle does its best but it's nowhere as good as a genuine Mexican restaurant.
author: Philip C.

description:
I can't believe people are coming in here badmouthing my family like this! .

Everybody at Chipotle Stonestown are like the little brothers and sisters I've always wanted...mainly because they give me fresh burrito bowls and chips in exchange for currency. I usually get double steak on the bowls and have never had a problem with their quality. The location is always busy so there's never food sitting out and it's definitely one of the healthiest options in the Stonestown area besides going to Trader Joe's and staring at Kale. I'm not sure what people expect when they go to Chipotle, but the laid back, chill and friendly vibe everyone gives off at this location is exactly why I go here at the end of the day. Keep it up fam!
author: Justin G.

description: Taste-wise, chipotle is alright. The price is a little bit on the pricier range for the amount that they give you. I ordered the steak bowl, and I watched the server readjust to give me less meat and fajita as well as rice. Overall, I would only come to this chipotle location if I'm in the area and was super hungry. Otherwise, pass or ask for more as they serve you.
author: Gary G.

description:
I don't understand what's so good about Chipotle. The food is bland. If you want real Mexican food, go to a taqueria in the Mission. There's plenty there that offer food that is magnitudes better and tastier than the stuff sold at Chipotle.

Although the staff is very friendly, the food quality just doesn't cut it. I had a burrito and it was tasteless. The dry carne asada meat wasn't distributed evenly throughout. And majority of the burrito was rice. What's even more bizarre was that only white or brown rice offered, no spanish rice.

I don't have a hatred toward chains, nor do I avoid them. But Chipotle is one of those that I wouldn't revisit.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Can add anything to your meal. So have them pipe on the rice, beans, and salsa. Get a double wrap for your burrito.
author: Will L.

description:
I love Chipotle; it is pretty much a to-go-to joint after a good workout.
I've been to many Chipotles and this place is pretty much standard. The staff members here work extra fast and have a great sense of humor. From time to time, they like to make small talk. I always order the steak or chicken burrito bowl. I agree with most of the reviewers that they do skimp out on food portions. In most cases, I usually call them out on this. I would avoid getting the chips here; the past few times I had it, it was starting to turn stale. As far as tables goes, there are plenty of seating inside and outside. Overall, it's located at a great location and like any other chains, you can't expect tooooo much from them.
author: Emily L.

description:
Super stingy tiny portions! Sometimes there are literally only 6-8 cubes of meat in your meal, which is a total rip off for what they are charging now--it would come down to probably $1 per tiny meat cube. Every other Chipotle I've been to gives twice the amount of food. 

The staff also used to have a lot of attitude and would glare at you or make sarcastic remarks if you asked for a little more meat, but I think they replaced a few people and now there seem to be friendlier servers now. A couple times I've gone they've also had "outages" where they don't have main ingredients. 

If you want chips and guac, prices will run you $12-$14. Remember back when fast food was less than $10?
author: bella l.

description:
Is Chipotle owned by McDonald's?  Yes,  No doubt about that.

I don't enjoy the McDonald's style of vegies and its flavor.  Hard for me to believe that they are all GMO free food.   
If it is truly GMO free food I will be so glad and so does others but the flavor is too far away from the natural ingredients.
author: Piano B.

description:
I LOOOVE Chipotle.
I DO NOT love this Chipotle.
I got a steak burrito bowl, which is my absolute favorite, and was VERY disappointed. Almost every bite of this bowl came with an unchewable piece of steak. And although the salsa claimed to be mild IT WAS NOT. I'm giving this location two stars because the service was very friendly but sadly the food was a no. I suggest just going to the location at Lakeshore Plaza!
author: Shaylene L.

description:
This place is just okay. I think maybe because they give extremely small portions. I was rather disappointed by the amount of chicken I got for my burrito bowl. The toppings were also insufficient. 
I think if you're going to pay $6 for a burrito, you might as well hit up a legit place in the mission district. They're authentic & they tend to be more generous with their portions. Other than that, the employees were friendly & I liked how I didn't need to wait very long to order. I just spent 2 hours at the mall & worked up an appetite. This is definitely the place to go in the mall for Mexican food.
author: Brittany D.

description: The people who made our burritos were really friendly and nice! The food tasted fresh and the line didnt take so long.
author: Tina R.

description:
There are days when I actually crave a chubby Chipotle burrito. They may not be authentic...or inexpensive...and they might charge ridiculous amounts for a dollop of guac...but there's just something about them that  keeps me coming back. I was super excited when I heard this chain was opening up at Stonestown last year. They seemed like a beacon of hope after that dreaded Chevy's closed. While the food tastes the same as any other Chipotle, the service and portions were a bit disappointing. 

I've ordered my share of burrito bowls and my experience here was just strange. First, the girl didn't say hi when I went up to the counter, and then when I asked for a burrito bowl she proceeded to fill it with brown rice, skimpy amounts of steak, beans, and sauce and pretty much called it a day. She started to go for the lid to close it and I was thinking to myself "uhhh hello there are other ingredients over there!" I'm used to the servers saying "everything on it? or trying to upsell that deliciously overpriced green gold to me, but not here. I had to specifically ask for lettuce, tomatoes, corn, cheese, and sour cream, and although all of those ingredients aren't standard, half of those typically are. And she made every additional ingredient I requested seem like a burden. Most Chipotles are pretty efficient with their service and get through their lines, but not here. They're typically understaffed and clearly haven't been trained well. 

On a better note, this particular location, being new and all, is clean, bright, and modern inside with both bar stools and table seating. They're one of the healthier mall food court type options and a good addition to the area.
author: Deanna Y.

description: Indoor and outdoor seating. I usually get their chicken burrito bowl, not the wrapped burrito, because it's convenient to take to-go and easier to consume. The chicken usually tastes the best; the steak tends to be dryer.  The white rice is seasoned with cilantro and lemon (love it).  It's fast and even though there was a health scare before, I've never had a problem there! And it's right at stonestown mall, next to peets coffee.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I want to give this chipotle 5 stars for their amazing staff. I really like their staff because they are personable. But where they fall short is the consistency in food and attention to detail. I can see why it's hard because you have about 4 people making your food. However, they forgot to put lettuce in my meal. I ordered multiple of bowls so I couldn't see them make all of it because it kept sliding down the line. When I got home, I noticed and got sad. A few were good in portion and the others were extremely skimp. Sigh. Not sure if I want to come back to this particular location.

:(
author: Sweets N.

description: First time here and it gave both my girlfriend and I diarrhea. Also, they didn't even give us a full scoop of meat. Will never come back. The Lakeshore plaza location is way better.
author: Andy Z.

description: This is awful!! I tried to get a simple Brito but they made it so more complicated. They put all the wrong ingredients on and put spicy sauce and I almost burned my mouth. If u didn't have to choose a star I wouldn't put one. The tortilla was ice cold ( I caught hypothermia) my doctor wasn't happy  They didn't put enough tin foil and the thing fell to pieces and I was eating a pooping bruito. I'm solo sorry to anyone who has eaten here. Pray for me and pray this place goes out of business
author: Marissa D.

description:
This Chipotle is ALWAYS slammed.  With the mall and SF State in proximity, it's no wonder they're always grinding and as other reviewers note "feel like rushing you" - they're ON IT.  

No matter what time of day I've gone the staff is super nice and I'm happy this is by the gym attached to Stonestown.  Healthier option than other food court food spots and plenty of parking as opposed to restaurants on the way home in the sunset, so I can go in and out.
author: Nadia D.

description:
LOVE Chipotle, dislike this location.

The staff is either super friendly, or really cranky, who will slap your food into the bowl all messy, making me think that our CA inmates probably get better service at their cafeteria. 

The portions are WAY stingy, they always make sure you get a barely leveled scoop or less, which makes double-meat here the same as regular meat at ALL the other locations. If there's very little meat left in the container, you're SOL, cos that's all you're getting. They are even stingy with rice and corn, which is totally ridiculous given how cheap they are. Even worse when it comes to the guacamole, which you're paying extra for! 

Decent seating selection and the occasional happy staff member are the only stars this location gets. The portions are really off though, might just start driving the extra mile and go to the newly opened one on Sloat at Merced Manor.
author: Jade T.

description: Don't get me wrong, I love Chiptole. I come here every Thursday. Only reason why I come to this location is because it's closer to my house. The portion consistency is just horrible at this location. Some days that I come, the portion is generous. Other days I go, the portion is half the size from my precious visit. Paying $10 for a steak bowl w/ guacamole is not worth it to me if the portion is just blah. I'll be sure to bring my own avocado next time. Other than the inconsistency of their portions, the food is great. It fits my diet. The manager there has great customer service. He's always on his A game. He's always working his ass off. Fast service is what I like!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Just because I love Chipotle. 

Make sure you greet and smile to the workers there who are prepping your food! They will be friendly back and possibly hook you up on toppings! 
 
This location is always busy during the afternoon so be ready to wait in line. 

But what I like about this particular location is that they have a good majority of tables for people who are eating there.
author: Darrell N.

description: I got chipotle catering for my boyfriends birthday party last week. Chipotle makes it so easy! I called the day before and picked it up the next day. I ordered enough for 20 people and it was the perfect amount. I got the 2 meat spread and received steak, chicken, white and brown rice, black and pinto beans, 2 sets of cheese, lettuce and guacamole and 1 bowl of each salsa, hard and soft tacos shells and 3 huge bags of their amazing chips. They included tongs, utensils, plates, bowls, napkins and metal holders to keep the food hot! Although I only lit the fire for a half hour because it heated up the room really quickly. The total with tax and tip was $300 but I didn't have to buy anything extra because they gave me everything I needed! Everyone loved the food and I will definetly get chipotle catering again! Thanks (:
author: Katie H.

description: They have gotten kinda crappy. I'm use to the free smiles, great service and well stocked with all the fixings.  They're always out of rice, lemon slices, corn and sometimes other stuff. You would think if you keep seeing that you're running out of things to order more. They just don't get it. Today I went in and the girl said no more brown rice. I said are you guys making some and she said no more today. Then the other girl comes out and says that they have more.  Smh
author: Erick M.

description: I love the recipe for the average Chipotle chicken burrito. Corn, lettuce, pico, chicken, rice, peppers, hot salsa, and some sour cream. This is a good location for a Chipotle. It's always easier to grab fast food than sit down at a restaurant.
author: Denise C.

description: When I got there not much meat was left so they were skimping on my burrito, look at my photo..Where's the beef!!?? The only thing that tasted a bit off was the rice, it wasn't cooked long enough. Other than that tastes like any other Chipotle.
author: Karen T.

description:
Still fairly new but as I mentioned to a friend, by a certain time they should have their sh*t together. Being "new" can only be an excuse for so long. 

First couple times we went, staff kept forgetting order and had to re-ask what kind of meat/fillings almost 3 times. Wow. It is NOT that complicated. Also, since they were still in training phase for new employees, they had the trainees on the line which CLEARLY IS A NO-NO DURING HIGH VOLUME RUSHES. Luckily it wasn't that busy but holding up the line for 10 mins while the trainee learns how to wrap a burrito is nonsense! Don't you have a mock station in the back to practice at???

The boss/owner is kind of a douche, always seems to have some type of strict bitchy attitude esp. towards staff.

But what REALLY kills me is their guacamole. The worst I've had yet from a Chipotle, and I usually love Chipotle's guacamole.
author: Marquis A.

description:
Fast service
Good burritos plus they're big! 
But the mild salsa is still spicy.
author: Animal K.

description:
Surprised this chipotle location isn't as highly rated as I thought. Oh well, with that said let the four stars unravel. 

I love chipotle. Period. I do agree it is hard transitioning from real taqueria burritos in the mission to going to chipotle. But you'll see why. 1. Customer service is okay, some workers should improve on their mood though. The manager seems chill tho. 2. The food is awesome. I usually get a chicken or steak burrito or burrito bowl. The corn here is omg. So good. The corn is a must have whenever you're here. 3. The food is affordable! $7 for bowl or burrito. 4. The atmosphere here is very chill. Also they don't close their doors exactly at closing time, which is a plus. You can still walk in at 9:56pm and they're serve you. I'll be back, chipotle! "Chipotle is mah life"
author: L R.

description: Not so good. My steak burrito was so dry and their guacamole was too expensive. Same thing with the tacos we ordered.
author: Eana T.

description:
I'd like to give this Chipotle 5 stars but its more like 4. 
First off, well done with the portions. However, there is a lack of urgency within lunch rush hours. If you've got the time to wait, definitely take your time with ordering a burrito. The last thing you'd wanna see is the tortilla ripping. Great communication among staff but it might get repetitive for the hungry consumer. 
Second, more knowledge of the menu written/ unwritten would be nice. It would definitely help with getting through the line. 
Third, thank goodness for Chipotle at Stonestown. I wasn't having any of that Jalapeños bullshit in the food court.
author: Cerina C.

description: Thank you for accommodating my last minute Chipotle catering today for 20 today!!  The food was delicious.  I was so impressed from the moment we picked up the food.  You made the process so easy and painless.  The staff was super friendly.  The food was all organized and ready to go.  It was packaged well and you even helped bring the food to our car.  You guys thought of everything!  The burners to keep the food warm, the matches, serving spoons, etc.  Amazing job!!!
author: chee r.

description: I have never written a review on here before but after eating a chicken bowl this past Tuesday, I got food poisoning. Will not be returning back to this location. Be careful.
author: Bryce Y.

description: I love chipotle, and I'm so glad they added this one at stonestown! Lots of seating, a very modern look, and extra friendly employees. I'm sure this will become a very busy and popular location.
author: Kira M.

description: I usually enjoy Chipotle. I went there today to get a veggie burrito. I was told that the fajitas would be done in five minutes, which was perfect because that was the time I needed to leave for a seminar. After ten minutes, I went back up to the cashier and she said that they forgot about my burrito and that the fajitas were already done. I was instructed to go to the back of the line and the staff moved extremely slowly. I finally got my burrito, but I was fifteen minutes late. I am extremely dissappinted in the lack of costumer service and will stick to the Marin location's. A new manager and more personable staff would be greatly appreciated..
author: Alexander C.

description: In the 2 visits I've ever made here, I've been disappointed with they're performance. The worker seem to always been scrambling to refill the ingredients. There's a lack of enthusiasm that really discourages me from wanting to stay in the eat. Compared to past experiences with Chipotle, I have to say that this location skimps out on the portions. The only reason why I'm granting them 3 stars instead of 2 is because I have a respect for the establishment and their use of fresh ingredients.
author: Greg Y.

description: I told my brother to buy me a chipotle and he bought from this one but when i open the bowl it was like 1/4 bowl i mean rice is a cheap thing i understand they put meat little but rice is cheap and they always put soooo little i am not going to eat chipotle again never the money they take is 8 bucks for bowl but they deserve 4 at most
author: İsmail Cem E.

description:
In general I love Chipotle and have been getting take-out burrito bowls from here every week this year, but this location is sadly inconsistent. I used to get chicken burrito bowls and my husband and I noticed that the spicy-ness varied greatly week to week. Some weeks it was fine and then the next week it would be way-over-the-top spicy. 

Then recently I have been ordering the carnitas burrito bowls and noticed that they have been adding more and more salt into the meat every week. Not only is it unhealthy and just gross, it totally over-powers the freshness of the corn and salsa and absolutely does not live up the quality standards I expect from Chipotle. 

Someone from Chipotle headquarters needs to seriously come down here and sort out this crew!
author: Melissa S.

description: Gentleman cooking today at 5:15 Id advise not licking your fingers and eating bell peppers when u have customers waiting... I believe that's a health and safety issue. Yes I called you out...
author: Waldo W.

description:
Ive been here three times now.
The first time there was a long line (isn't there always) but I waited.  When I eventually got my Burrito it seemed like they were trying to save food for the Apocalypse or something, probably the smallest chipotle burrito i've ever had.
The second time the portion size was great, almost too much.
Third time, small burrito again, but here's the worst part.  They were down to to the last bit of beans, I asked if they were going to refill them and if they were I would wait.  The girl said yes they would and then just scooped out the last 4 1/2 beans for my burrito and then moved me along.
Each time my burrito's have been pretty boring in the flavor department, I don't know if they are just new and haven't gotten it all down yet or if its a bad  restaurant, either way...2 stars
author: John S.

description:
The service has improved in the posts month or two.  

Pleasant environment.

Probably our favorite Chipotle now.  

-1 star only bc there seems to be constantly a line.

Gluten-free folks: get the Bowls or Tacos.
author: George K.

description:
My boyfriend ate a chicken burrito at your Sloat Blvd location tonight around 7:00PM.  After a couple hours of being home he started getting very sick.  He picked up some sort of food virus from Chipotle.  We are very dissatisfied with the quality of food.  His stomach has been hurting since he ate the chicken burrito.  Please alert your staff to wash there hands and cook meat all the way through.

Will never eat at Chipotle again.
author: Angela K.

description: I've placed 3 orders on the chipotle app, only 1 of which was ready on time - and they got my order wrong. The other two orders weren't even started until I showed up, which was 15 mins after it was supposed to be ready. Also, you pay via the app, but every time they try to charge me at the counter. I've complained to the manager already. I order because I don't have time to wait.
author: Caleb N.

description:
On a Tuesday evening, came here with some friends after shopping for a quick dinner.  This is new so the interior is new and clean.  Staff is slow at food preparation so the line was slow moving and started to get long.

As soon as we came up to order, the ingredients started running low...first the fajitas (bell peppers), the barbacoa, then the 5-8 minute wait.  I've been to chipotle locations in peninsula and SF downtown and never saw where so many items were running out.  Usually it would have been refilled beforehand.  My friend ahead of me got the last of the fajitas but only a very small spoonful in her bowl that got her moving thru the line, and my friends and I ended up waiting for the next batch.  I come to wonder what all the staff were doing in the kitchen, as they were just starting to cook the next batch of items that ran out.

I ordered a bowl for myself and a burrito to go.  Both were just slightly smaller portions than the other chipotle locations; however, the mix of flavors were good since it was not dry.  

Service was poor.  It doesn't seem the staff behind the counter had retail experience as they were very forgetful in the things orders/preparation, and had to be asked several times (medium sauce on the side..... oh, also medium sauce sauce on the side (2nd reminder, then to the cashier, yes that's my sauce too).  They forgot to give my friend her chips for the kid menu.  No smiles or welcoming attitude.

Lastly, the bathroom code is printed on your receipt (we all had the same code, so its probably changed daily or as needed)!

Overall, food is good (slightly smaller), service is poor.  Hopefully this will be worked out after a bit more practice in operating and the portions get larger.
author: Ju D.

description:
I'm a pretty frequent visitor here at this chipotle location. I usually get a brown rice chicken bowl, but this time I was adventurous and got the carnitas brown rice bowl!

It was yummy, but I found a piece of hair in mine): I still give chipotle 4 stars because of how friendly the staff were when they created my bowl.

I would still continue going to this chipotle. But next time I would give my bowl back for them make me a new one if this happens again. :)
author: Kaylie L.

description: Portion size has improved significantly since it's opened. However, quality is still hit or miss. This has gotten a long-term spot on my Chipotle-blacklist.
author: Jay F.

description: Too much salt and pepper.  This place used to have better food. What's with all the extra salt?
author: Mimi J.

description: Maybe it was the warm afternoon sun.  Maybe it was the company of delightful friends.  But this place is good.  The staff here were pleasant with a good sense of humor.  The tables were plentiful inside and out.  I would definitely come back and enjoy another carne asada burrito and make more memories.  Those rare sunny SF days.
author: John P.

description: This place blows. Its all hype. It isn't even a burrito, its like a big ball stuffed with mexican style food. Oh yeah and it is super over priced. About 10 bucks for a burrito with guacamole and chips (no soda). One star for the brown cilantro lime rice. The steak was bland, thick and super chewy, toppings where minimal and lacked flair. I will take my future burrito cravings to El Farolito in the Mission. Its worth the drive. Believe me.
author: Yosof R.

description: I LOVE CHIPOTLE but this location SUCKS. I live right by Stonestown and frequently order online for pickup, NOT ONCE in the last NINE times have they had my order ready at the pickup time (and even if I'm 15-20 minutes late), every time, ive had to wait for them to make it along with everyone else. As someone who eats here often, this is incredibly frustrating, and they barely even apologize. Today, they did say sorry a few times, but not only was my bowl not ready 30 minutes after pickup time, they were also out of 3 of the ingredients which would have been in my bowl had they made it on time. I kept waiting to write a review and giving them multiple chances, but now I've had it.  It just seems like there's no accountability when they mess up and that nobody gives a shit.
author: Nika G.

description:
I like the sofritas bowl or burrito, a great Veggie option with organic braised tofu. You get a choice of brown or white rice, black or pinto beans. The meat choices are the usual, chicken, carnitas. You may choose mild, medium or hot sauce. Choices of other additions included in the price are sour cream, lettuce, cheese, and 3 different sauces. The only extra cost item is the guacamole. Very good and efficient for fast Mexican food! I will Definitely go back!!

Best thing about Chipotle is the food taste good, it's quick and filling!
author: BJ S.

description: Awful..customer service sucks. Literally threw my food at me. Food was messy wasn't even well put together. Fell apart while i was eating. They hired a bunch of kids who just sit around joking around all day. Wouldn't even feed my dog this food.
author: Mike H.

description:
Chipotle replaced the old Chevy's, but only took half the space.  The other space is reserved for a sushi restaurant that is due to open in the next few weeks.  Chipotle redecorated to a modernistic look, but the atmosphere seems cold.  The chairs are hard and uncomfortable and the poorly designed painted concrete floor was easily scuffed by the chairs.  The annoyingly loud music distracted from any dining pleasure.

We arrived today a little after 1 PM and it was still pretty busy.  Most of the patrons looked like students with their big big packs.  We ordered a steak burrito and a burrito in a bowl for about $7 apiece.  My steak burrito was tasteless and even the provided hot sauce did not give it much flavor.  The food is much better tasting and value at Burrito Express or Gordo's.  The Burrito Eater would probably give this place a 5 or 6 mustache.

For being a new place, the restaurant is rather dirty.  The floors are unswept, the tables are dirty, and even the adjacent walls are splattered with grease like substance.  Maybe the staff ought to get off their haunches and do a little maintenance.

Been here, done that, unlikely to eat here again.
author: Robert J.

description:
As an avid Chipotle fan, I've been to several locations in California. This one is comparable to the rest in terms of quality but portions here are SO tiny! Most Chipotles give 1.5-2 scoops of rice by default but this one gives one little baby scoop unless I ask them for more, which I always have to do. But I also suspect that when I ask for more of one thing they give a smaller portion of something else just to keep my overall bowl smaller. I've been here a bunch of times just because it's at a convenient location and it's always the same. Consistently smaller than any other Chipotle.

So I went here again earlier today and it was the final straw when they skimped on my corn for the last time. Seriously, everyone knows I love my corn at Chipotle and always get extra. The girl gives me a tiny 1/3 scoop of corn. I ask for extra. She gives me another baby 1/3 scoop and passes it. I look at her with my mouth open in dismay. How are you going to give me less than a default scoop when I ask for extra? Then the next girl gives me 5 strands of lettuce. Seriously? Y'all can go f yourselves. 

But on a serious note, it's probably not their fault since their portions are always consistently small. It's most likely management since they dictate what amount to give. So management, y'all can go f yourselves.
author: Kari G.

description:
So I have been in love with Chipotle since I tried it for the first time in the 8th grade (which was like back in 2008). But let me tell you, out of all the Chipotles I have been to in the Bay Area, I have to say that this one is the best one. I might be a bit biased because I know some people who work here/have worked here in the past, but this location especially takes its time to make sure all the ingredients are fresh and prepared for the day and evening. And you see that right as they're making your orders right in front of you. Not only that, but the workers definitely know how to pack a bowl til the point where you're so full, you feel like you're in a food coma. All the other locations I've been to? Yeah, they'll give you what you ask for, but you're never completely satisfied. This place definitely takes the cake, and I'm really mad at myself for not coming here sooner because I know that I'm definitely going to get what I paid for.

And on a side note, the restaurant itself looks gorgeous on the inside. The lighting isn't too bright or dim, and there's lots of space to move which is a bonus in my book.

Thanks for the great experience, Chipotle at Stonestown. Y'all rock. ^_____^
author: Sherilyn T.

description: This Chipotle is okay. Most Chipotles are okay. Just okay. Most of the times I've been here the staff seem kind of absent and there's not really a sense of urgency, which is probably why the line is so slow. Tonight a girl made my bowl and then just left me at an empty cash register with a guy in front of me. Like there weren't any people behind us, she just stood by the tortilla warmer until the cashier came out from the bathroom and helped us. Kind of weird. They can be skimpy on your ingredients of it's a little busy.
author: Lauren F.

description: I want the fresh tomato salsa INSIDE the quesadilla. This was WAY too complicated for them. The dude told me I could only have the salsa on the side. I guess it messes up their machine. ANY taqueria will put whatever you desire inside a quesadilla; it's a no-brainer.
author: Kristin A.

description: Wow, I should have read the reviews before coming to the Chipotle at Stonestown. It would have saved me some grief. So I basically agree with the majority of the reviews. This Chiptotle was super stingy on everything from the steak to the corn salsa. I have never seen a burrito so small; I was embarrassed for it. The container that had the steak was very low already. Instead of scooping out the rest (which wouldn't equal a spoonful), the server scooped out half of what was already a sorry amount. It might as well have been a vegetarian burrito. It was so bad, I will NEVER come back to this Chipotle and suggest others do the same. I feel the quality and quantity you get would be inconsistent. And really, fool me once, shame on you. But fool me twice...
author: Jo L.

description: This is the best chipotle around! Always make sure Breanna helps you! I always go there with my girl friend and they love our puppy. Breanna gives great customer service and rolls the burritos really good! All employees are really cool and love us! As for the guy that seems to be the manager, his name is homer, isn't that friendly and very awkward. This place could be so much better with new management which is why I give it 3 stars. He has really disappointed my visits there because he always kicks one of us out because of our puppy, my dog is a training therapy dog and I should be allowed to take him anywhere. Homer is really rude and gave my girl friend attitude "get that dog out of here. NNNOOWWW!!!" I wouldn't be so offended by him if he would have said it nicely and not with attitude, my girl friend tried telling him that it was a therapy dog and he did not even care he just said "uh out!, like now" really rude management. I will continue to go there because the employes are really nice and don't mind the dog, customers don't either. Homer is just an awkward unfriendly guy. He tried hitting on the girl that was behind me in line, he's a real disappointment to the place. I don't mind the fact that he told us that the dog isn't allowed because it's a food place, but when it's a therapy dog and I'm allowed to take him in, don't give attitude to me, my girl friend or your employees. I have every right to be in there with the dog. Not only his rudeness but the food portion homer gave us compared to everyone else really disappointed my visit to their chipotle.
author: Kevin B.

description: I went to this chipotle after shopping at the mall.  I was very excited to order the salad with the amazing dressing they have there! After I ordered my salad and paid for everything, I walked over to get a fork and realized they did not have any.  So i went to a worker and she told me they ran out of forks..... ok? couldn't you have told me that BEFORE I ordered my salad! I then had to eat a salad with a spoon..
author: Alexa M.

description: I placed quite a large order for a large amount of people with only a couple hours' notice.  I work in the service industry so I understand that things happen so I was not upset that it was not ready when I expected.  But once it was ready and the meals were distributed several of us to found that our meals were made incorrectly, ingredients skimped on, the chicken was chewy and so cold that it must have just been defrosted...  No.  That is just unacceptable.  What they should have done was called and told us that at the moment they could not handle an order that large so we could make other arrangements.  Instead they half assed the whole order and practically scolded us for not putting the order in with more notice.  We've never received this kind of attitude from the Westlake location with the same amount of notice. Going forward I will continue to do my business with the Westlake location.  Stonestown will be fine giving garbage service to SFSU students wanting a cheap meal off campus that isn't McDonald's and Mercy High School brats that take up space splitting 1 burrito bowl amongst 4 people.
author: Jessica F.

description: I've always loved chiptole and this is a pretty easy location with parking.  Since it is a chain, you can expect everything from quality and taste to be about the same at other locations.  This area here is pretty big and I loved the food.  I usually go for the chicken burrito bowl.  This time I came a bit late today though about half an hour before closing.  I was completely disappointed to find out that they ran out of the corn salad and guacamole already!  I guess its too late that they didn't want to make anymore.  It wasn't the same without those two though especially since they were my favorites :(
author: Teresa W.

description: I work in the mall and have been coming to this chipotle since they opened due to its convenience. When it first opened I chopped up the horribly slow service to the fat that it was new and their employees were probably just learning the ropes. But now months later I am absolutely baffled as to how they have not corrected the very obvious bottleneck in their system! Most of the time they have one person at the register, someone to add the toppings, and someone to start your order. But the first person always gets stuck adding the meat and sometimes making the entire meal cuz the second person is off somewhere else. This is one of the only chipotles who has not realized that there need to be three people on their line unless it is slow which is rare for this location. They have enough people to do it!
author: Nadia B.

description: your typical chipotle, the line here usually moves pretty quick, and its in a rather convenient location
author: Long C.

description: Chipotle's my usual place to go for "fast food" when I need something quick that's not going to give me a heart attack later. However, this place is anything from "fast". Came around 2pm for a late lunch and with only 4 people ahead of me, it took over 20 minutes to get my food. Talk about the slowest Chipotle I have been to. They just opened up so I'll give it another shot a few weeks later when they get their stuff together.
author: Steven B.

description: With all the other variety of Mexican food and taquerias we have in the city, I think there are much better places to eat Mexican food than here.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Let me premise this review with the fact that I LOVE chipotle! The service is really slow here and I feel like despite all the space they have they can't quite get it together. At other locations they are able to get the line down fast but they don't seem to hustle as quickly here. I gave it two stars because I love the food.
author: Melissa N.

description: My best friend brought me here to try it out.  Wow, Americanized Mexican food, how gross! Had a Burrito, thought putting some salsa on it would make it more edible, NOT!  Don't know what the rave is about Chipotle in general, I'm not impressed!  Aye caramba not coming back!!!
author: Spooky B.

description: I have tried several Chipotles in the Bay Area and this one is by far the best. Their food actually tastes fresh and their service is quick unlike most Chipotles.
author: Michelle R.

description: Clean, but these lines! I guess it should start clearing up soon, but there is still a lot of hype about how this is new. Am still heading here from SFSU a lot and have eaten here several times and have always had consistent meals.
author: Michael M.

description: Portion sizes are small and the staff, although friendly, seem to want to rush through the process to get to the next customer so I always feel like I will be holding up the line if I ask for extra rice.  Did I mention the small portions?
author: Mickey N.

description: I go to Sf state and this place keeps on forgetting items such as the first time getting charged for guacamole side but didn't get it , than now I got charged a bag of chips and they didn't give it to me. Not if the hipsters behind the cash registers get with the program this place wouldn't be so bad. The girls behind the food counter were nice.
author: Karl B.

description: When I went,  the service was fine, food was expected- fresh and generous portions.
author: Sandy C.

description: GROSSSSS! I don't see how people see Chipotle as appealing Mexican food. I ordered some rice bowl w/ carne asada and it was just soggy spanish rice topped w/ various ingredients. I don't even know what else to say besides I'm never trying this place again. The service was friendly but even that wasn't good enough to compensate for such a horrible lunch.
author: Lily W.

description: Ok... I've only been here once. Food was great. Nothing was soggy or gross. My only complaint is that they really skimp on stuff. Portions were really small. Other than that, didn't have a problem on the first visit. Let's see how the next visit goes...
author: Wendy R.

description: Good food, great customer service (for some employees). The last time I came here the portion was a little smaller than usual. (I think you have to ask for a little more) But it did fill me up without my stomach wanting to explode. I love love love their dressing (vinaigrette)!!!! It's delicious and I don't care if its fat. Sometimes they forget to give it to me but that's fine because all the flavors in their ingredients are still as delicious without it. Sometimes I think I have a chipotle addiction because I have a tendency to eat it about once a week!
author: Carmen L.

description: The burrito was quite costly compared to other burrito places, but I loved the food anyways; as well as the awesome customer service. The hosts were really friendly and I walked out a happy person.
author: Edward M.

description:
Interesting reviews that I have read here already. Many are right on with what I will be reviewing as well. First of all, I am VERY happy this chain has made it's way onto this side of the city. If you walk around downtown, there seems to be one on every block but not the case over here. So nice for the college kids to have another option other than McD's or food court 'cuisine'. 
My one and only main complaint of this store are the portions they serve depending on who's doing the packing. I've been to many Chipotles in the city and throughout the bay area and I always order the chicken bowl. LOVE it! So far, the tenderness and the flavor of the chicken is no different anywhere else....thank goodness!
The norm has been the filled to the top portions with lots of lettuce and other goodies. 
The other day, I had my mom pick me up a bowl. Since her English is limited, I wrote down everything I wanted. Always the same with brown rice, black beans, chicken, mild salsa, double corn salsa and lettuce.  Of course, she was just the courier so watching the gal pack it in, my mom has no idea what to expect. 
When she brought it home, I was starving by then. I carefully opened up the foil lid, expecting the lettuce to come falling out but nothing. The entire portion was so scarce! I was shocked! Thought I forgot to put something in there but when I checked, nothing seemed to be missing. Just very scarce with the rice and other ingredients. Wow. Did not think they could differ so much! 
In hindsight, it was probably better for me to have the smaller portion....and who knows, maybe this gal was packing thinking it was for my mom who is a teeny, tiny thing!! Regardless, they should have a standard portion consistency in ALL Chipotles. But this does not deter me from my chicken bowl whatsoever!!
author: Naomi N.

description: Like every other Chipotle, it is amazing with one extra bonus point they sell beer. The staff is actually upbeat and the environment is really nice.
author: Blake D.

description: Welp that was terrible. Out of tortillas, sour cream, and chipotle Tabasco sauce. I guess the woman helping me thought the lack of sour cream could be made up with loads of hot salsa and cheese. Wish me luck eating/disgusting this bowl.
author: Jake H.

description:
About 3 weeks, we ate there in the afternoon and I ordered three adult combo and 2 kids meal but I was not happy with the way they provided my kids meal because they were busy so they only provided me with one corn, one salad , one nachos and 2 small containers of chicken for the kids's taco.  However, the chicken was only 1/3 filled on each, therefore, I took it back the casier and ask him "how do I make two tacos with little chicken?" and I paid for 2 orders?  He apologized immediately and had the lady next to him fill it up for me.  Given I paid for the price of two, I should be getting two sides of each.  

The service was good but the way the food portion was so little or less when placing the same orders.  I would recommend one order per item especially when they're busy because you will not get your money's worth with small portion.
author: Janey J.

description:
Horrible!!!!!

Second time here during the same exact time (Dinner time 8PM).  

First time they ran out of Guacamole for the chips.
Second time, ran out of corn for the burrito and had to wait.

You would think that having 5 employees that they would be able to keep things stock and ready to serve your customers. How can you run out of food during dinner time? 
Who is the manager for this place?

There is definitely a lack of consistency of the service and availability of food choices at this location compare to any other that I've been to.

Quote from the cashier, "I can't wait to leave this place because the lack of management."
author: C Y.

description: Probably the worst chipotle I have been to. It's discouraging that they have hired such careless and unprofessional employees when there are large numbers of deserving people out looking for jobs. This chipotle has the feel of a college campus dining hall and I can almost guarantee will result in a bad experience for you.
author: Kate T.

description: I was here a few days ago and ordered two corn tortilla chicken tacos. They put a very small amount of rice on both of the tortillas, and sort of gave me an attitude when I asked for a little more. When I got to the register to pay I was charged $11.55, which I automatically knew was incorrect. I told the girl that the amount was incorrect (she was new). Another employee came over to help her out. There was no apology for the mistake, nothing at all. With that said the overall service was very... bland. Everyone working there seemed to be pretty young and totally uninterested with providing good customer service. It's a NO for me - they really deserve 0 stars.
author: Daniel M.

description:
I've been here 3 times, hoping that this place was just off because it just opened, but I'm not coming back.  All 3 times I've received meager portions that definitely weren't worth the money I spent.  Just for reference, I ordered burrito bowls all 3 times. Maybe the burritos are more filling, but I was still hungry after eating my barely-filled bowl.
 
The third time I went, the manager was serving me because the service was so slow (even though there were only like 4 people in line) and he had to help out. Hoping to avoid another tiny meal, I asked for a little more chicken. He told me that that would be $2.40 extra. He must've noticed my pissed off expression, because he then added one little tiny piece of chicken, saying that he could give me a little extra for free, as if he was doing me a huge favor. Then apparently they were out of guacamole. That's all he said. He didn't tell me I could wait until they made more. He just said I couldn't have any. By the time I paid for my tiny burrito bowl, I decided I was done with this place.

Bye Stonestown Chipotle. I was hoping you'd be my savior from the SFSU dining halls, but I'd honestly rather eat there.
author: Jess S.

description: Lines around the restaurant every time, cooks laugh when burrito rips. The food is average, if they're ever in stock of the meat you want. $4 for a PBR was the nail in the coffin for this awful spot. Avoid at all costs.
author: Thomas C.

description:
I usually come in once or twice a week for a burrito bowl.  Love the options for brown rice, black beans, corn and the chips are addicting. Portions are a good size and usually allows me to save my leftovers for a snack later on.

Sometimes the line goes quickly and sometimes it barely moves.  They rarely are ready at their 11am opening and often open the doors late and then make you wait to pay until they retrieve the cash drawer for the register.

Yesterday, the line was barely moving along.  Had a nice chat with a coworker that was in line before me.  When I reach the register to pay I handed them a hundred dollar bill and a one dollar bill to pay for my $10.79 meal.  I was told that they couldn't accept the hundred dollar bill.  I asked for a manager since I only had a hundred, a five and a single dollar bill.  The manager, who never came out, just told the cashier to ask for another form of payment or ask me to go break the hundred dollar bill elsewhere.

I ended up going upstairs to Tokyo Express for lunch.  After work, I stop into Chipotle and asked to speak with a manager.  Oscar came over and introduced himself.  I explained the incident and how I wasted 20 minutes of my hour lunch only to have to seek lunch elsewhere.  Oscar apologized and offered me a complimentary meal.  I declined while thanking him for his gesture.

I will wait a week and try Chipotle again.  Hopefully, they will have signage that states they do not accept $100 bills.  If they don't and deny my payment again, I will take my business elsewhere.

Two stars for the portion sizes and Oscar's attempt to remedy the incident.
author: Hiromi C.

description: Worst Steak Burrito I have ever eaten. The smallest amount of steak with the largest amount of gristle.  What a combination!!
author: Mark N.

description: The fact that this place has a strong following in California where we have great Mexican food is amazing. There is real Mexican food everywhere here. This place is disgusting and overpriced. The guacamole was brown today. I didn't notice until I got back to work. I paid $2 for that. It tasted like it was scraped out of a garbage can. I have been going here for the sole reason that I work in the mall and wanted something different. Today was the last time I will ever go there. The people are nice enough except when they are calling me "boss". It is meant to be an insult when you call someone boss. I'm sure they don't mean it that way but it's still annoying. It also cracks me up when they are out of a specific ingredient and everyone stands around clueless. Most likely managers who feel above such a task. Thanks for the help boss. If I could give zero stars, I would.
author: Anthony E.

description: Dude this side of town desperately needs some decent burrito choices. This place makes some serious burrito mistakes, such as not throwing the meat on the grill quickly beforehand, not grilling the tortilla with the cheese so it gets all melty, etc. The beans were dry as hell, the rice was okay. I really don't see how people think this place is good. Maybe if I was stuck in Europe craving comfort food it could do the trick, but 3 miles from 24th and Mission? Come on.
author: Stefan C.

description: Don't get all the negative reviews. We were treated well and the food was good.  It was like any other Chipotle I have ever been to.
author: Bob R.

description: I love chipotle but when I came to this one it did not seem very fresh. The tortilla on my burrito ripped and they didn't rewrap it or arp another tortilla around it. I don't know it was sort of a bad experience.
author: Conner M.
